ygData.subject: Re: How to know if Anthem is really working
ygData.msgSnippet: Many people seem to discount the value of delay when it comes to choosing a weapon.  Ever since obtaining dual weild I have used two dwarven axes and let me
ygData.messageBody:
Many people seem to discount the value of delay when it comes to choosing a
weapon. Ever since obtaining dual weild I have used two dwarven axes and
let me tell you I'm a friggin cuisinart. I regularly group with a Ranger
who dual weilds a whip and a combine LS. I ALWAYS end up tanking when I
play anthem (this is with the ranger casting spells as well). The ranger
can't taunt anything off me for more than a couple of rounds. I recently
obtained a Pugius dagger (very nice!) and have been unable to sell my spare
dwarven axe. Most people prefer to stick with the heavy...slow mino axe. I
try and tell them the dwarven axe is lighter and faster...but they hear its
dam is 6 and usually turn their noses up at it. If only they knew...

If you see me on the Rathe and want an axe...give me a tell and I'll give
you a deal :)

Ruldaas
The Rathe


>From: scott@... (scott brisko)
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: [eqbards] How to know if Anthem is really working
>Date: Tue, 20 Jul 1999 09:39:13 -0700
>
>From: scott@... (scott brisko)
>
>Sure I have read everlore, eqvault, harpers, etc. but as much as I had read
>what the effects of Anthem de Arms was, I was never able to guage if the
>weapons speed increase was really working. Part of the problem was that I
>use a Mino axe, (very heavy, long delay) and most of the people that I
>group
>with are also using mino axes, or equally heavy/slow weapons.
>
>Last night I grouped with a rogue double wielding daggers. I have never
>seen
>someone hit so hit a mob so many times in my life. It was almost comical.
>
>Bernwyn
>Still being amazed
>
>
>
>
